meanings.definition: The point on the earth's surface directly above the focus of an earthquake.
meanings.sent1: During the earthquake, the epicenter was the spot right above where the shaking started.
meanings.sent2: Scientists quickly identified the epicenter of the earthquake to understand its impact.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was disrupted when the epicenter of the food fight hit the cake.
meanings.sent4: In the chaos of the classroom, her loud laughter became the epicenter of attention.
meanings.sent5: The epicenter of the storm brought heavy rain and strong winds to the town.

meanings.definition: The central point of something, typically a difficult or unpleasant situation.
meanings.sent1: The epicenter of the problem was the misunderstanding between the two friends.
meanings.sent2: She found herself at the epicenter of a heated argument between her siblings.
meanings.sent3: The epicenter of the chaos in the kitchen was the burnt dinner on the stove.
meanings.sent4: His sudden resignation became the epicenter of gossip in the office.
meanings.sent5: The epicenter of the movie's plot twist left the audience in shock.
